property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Choose a character committed to the same story as Interrogator. Until the end of the phase, that character does not count its skill at this story. Limit once per phase.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Disrupt: When an opponent triggers a card effect that targets a character you control, choose a card in a discard pile and put it on the top or bottom of its owner’s deck.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Overworked Bureaucrat gains +1 skill and gains # for each support card attached to it. When Overworked Bureacrat leaves play, return each card attached to it to its owner’s hand instead of being discarded.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: When you would uncommit Relentless Stalker from a story, you may choose to not uncommit it until the story is won.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: While you control Dr. Christine Marie each opponent plays with their hand revealed.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After you succeed at a conspiracy where Intelligence Agent is committed, shuffle that conspiracy back into it’s owner’s deck.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Forced Response: After you commit King John to a story, you must drain 1 of your domains. If you do not, uncommit King John.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: While your opponent has 2 or more characters committed to the same story as Keen-eyed Detective, he gains $%%.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After you commit Warrant Officer to a story, each _ character you control at that story gains #$.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Pay 1 to choose an opponent’s character committed to a story. Peerless Tracker gains all of that character’s printed icons and is now committed to the same story. Limit once per turn.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Non-Loyal characters do not count their struggle icons or skill at the same story Grete Wagner is committed to.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: While Crooked Cop is committed to a story he gains “Disrupt: When one or more characters at this story are targeted by a card effect, draw 1 card. Limit thrice per phase.”

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After you play a Hunter character, your opponent must choose and wound a character with a @ icon, if able.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attache gains +1 skill for each Government character you control. Your Government characters gain $.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Exhaust Lieutenant Wilson Stewart to reduce the cost of the next _ character you play this phase by X. X is the number of Government characters you control.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After an opponent’s character is destroyed by the results of a # struggle, choose a character card attached to a domain and discard it.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: You may drain multiple domains to pay for General Edward Irving. Response: After you lose a @ struggle at a story where General Edward Irving is committed, ready him.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: You may drain multiple domains to pay for Hunters of Ardenne. Your Hunter characters gain “Immune to opponent’s triggered card effects” while committed to a story.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: You may drain multiple domains to pay for The Foundation. For each domain beyond the first you drained when you play The Foundation, your opponent chooses a non-Ancient One character he controls and removes it from the game. Disrupt: Pay 1 to cancel an effect that would target 1 or more _ characters you control.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a character you control. While attached character is committed to a story, it counts its icons at each other story where you have 1 or more characters committed.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Each non-Government character committed to attached story is treated as if its text box was blank.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. # struggles resolve first at attached story. Disrupt: When an opponent would wound 1 of his characters for losing a # struggle at attached story, instead place 1 success token on this story.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Disrupt: Exhaust St. Hubert’s Key to cancel an effect that would either drive a character you control insane or wound a character you control.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to an _ character. Characters you control at the same story as the attached character gain Invulnerability. Action: Pay 1 to move Armored card to another _ character.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Characters you control with an attached Vehicle support card gain +1 skill and gain Fast. Action: Exhaust Motor Pool to search your deck for a Vehicle support card, reveal it and add it to your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Cancel the first effect triggered by each opponent each turn.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Choose a drained domain with 2 or more _ resources and refresh it.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Choose a character you control and a card an opponent controls with equal or lower cost. Until the end of the phase, treat the chosen cards’ printed text boxes as though they were blank (except for Subtypes).

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After a player triggers a character ability, exhaust that character. Until the end of the turn that character loses all icons and is treated as if its printed text box were blank.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Disrupt: When your opponent triggers the ability of a support card with printed cost X or less, put that support card on the bottom of its owner’s deck instead.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: The Usual Suspects takes 8 success tokens to win. Non-unique characters may not trigger abilities while committed to any other story.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Players cannot trigger effects from out of play unless they have a character committed to this conspiracy.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: While The Anderson Building is in play, when a player succeeds at a story he must resolve the effect of that story as if he had won it.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: While The Blackwood Initiative is in play, each player must choose and discard a card from his hand to resource a card.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Characters with printed skill 2 or less cost an additional 1 to play.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a character. Attached character gains ##.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Action: Until the end of the phase, your opponent must discard a success token from his side of a story to commit characters to that story, if able.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Forced Response: After all stories are resolved, each player that did not commit at least one character to a story must sacrifice a support card he controls, if able.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. % struggles are instead @ struggles at attached story.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After a character you control goes insane, draw 1 card. Limit once per phase.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Each struggle at attached story counts (T) icons in addition to that struggle’s normal icons.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After Jeremiah Kirby enters play, reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. An opponent chooses and puts one of those cards on the bottom of your deck, then you choose and add one of those cards to your hand. Repeat this process with the remaining 3 cards.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Forced Response: After a player wins an $ or % icon struggle at this story, he draws 1 card.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After Restless Mi-Go is destroyed place it on the top of your deck.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Response: After stories have resolved, if a character at this story was destroyed this phase reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, put a character card revealed by this effect into your hand and the rest of the cards on the bottom of your deck.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Order of the Silver Twilight

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After you play a support card, choose a character card in your discard pile and put it in your hand.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Order of the Silver Twilight

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Response: After a card is discarded from your hand, you may attach it to John Scott face-down. Response: After John Scott is readied, return a face-down card attached to him to your hand.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Order of the Silver Twilight

property.name: Card Text
property.value: August Lindquist cannot have Relic cards attached to him. Disrupt: If August Lindquist would be wounded, instead choose another character to be wounded. Then, place a success token on August Lindquist.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Order of the Silver Twilight

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Action: Discard a card from your hand to choose a struggle at the attached story. That struggle resolves an additional time this phase. Limit once per turn.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Order of the Silver Twilight

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a character. Forced Response: After you win an $ struggle, destroy attached character.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Forced Response: After you lose the skill check at a story that Escaped Convict is committed to, uncommit it and commit it to an unresolved story, if able.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Each opponent must choose a card from his hand and put it on the bottom of his deck to commit 1 or more characters to this story.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Forced Response: After stories resolve, if Obsessive Elder Thing did not commit to a story this phase, return it to your hand.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Attach to a story card. Response: After you win an $ struggle at the attached story, either draw 2 cards or return a card from your discard pile to the top of your deck.
